p: The mango pulp is known to have excellent bioactive compounds like carotenoids (pro-vitamin A, 3894 IU/100 g), phenolic acids, polysaccharides, sterols, and alkaloids. Mango is included in the TRAMIL list (a research project on medicinal plant resource in the Caribbean) as it is used by the indigenous people to treat diarrhea, fever, gastritis, and ulcers [ 50].
